Content-Type: text/plain;
	charset="iso-8859-1"
Content-Transfer-Encoding: quoted-printable

Due to politeness rules, if you are crawling only a few hosts, the crawler
=
will often be idleing, waiting before it can go fetch the next document.
 
=
This is normal and there is little you can do about it except lower the
pol=
iteness (which may not be advisable).
 
If there is no progress at all over=
 the course of several minutes (i.e. the
number of downloaded documents rem=
ains fixed) then you may be stuck trying
to download documents from a host =
that isn't responding (leading to
retries). The crawler will eventually giv=
e up on each document in that hosts
queue, but it can take a very long time=
.
 
- Kris

-----Original Message-----
From: archive-crawler@...=
m
[mailto:archive-crawler@yahoogroups.com] On Behalf Of callforshadab
Sent:=
 3. n=F3vember 2005 09:33
To: archive-crawler@yahoogroups.com
Subject: [arc=
hive-crawler] Zero Active thread....


Hi,
i am running the crawler with 50=
 threads. 
But many times in console i see  "Active count thread : 0 of 50"=
.
And i found the crawler with no progress. Consequently, its speed is
very=
 slow.

Is it mean that, there is no thread running on my system?? What sho=
uld
i do to speed up the crawling process.

with regards,
shadab
